titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 5278, PUERTO RICO OVERSIGHT, MANAGEMENT, AND ECONOMIC STABILITY ACT

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 5278, PUERTO RICO OVERSIGHT, MANAGEMENT, AND ECONOMIC STABILITY ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 91

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Puerto Rico Oversight, Management, and Economic Stability Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 5278, to establish an Oversight Board to assist the Government of Puerto Rico, including instrumentalities, in managing its public finances, by a recorded vote of 297 ayes to 127 noes, Roll No. 288.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-57 shall be considered as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule, in lieu of the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Natural Resources now printed in the bill.<P/>Torres amendment (No. 8 printed in H. Rept. 114-610) that sought to strike Section 403 (by a recorded vote of 196 ayes to 225 noes, Roll No. 287).<P/>Agreed that the Clerk be authorized to make technical and conforming changes to reflect the actions of the House.<P/>H. Res. 770, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5278) was agreed to by a yea-and-nay vote of 241 yeas to 178 nays, Roll No. 284, after the previous question was ordered without objection.

titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 5325, LEGISLATIVE BRANCH APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2017

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 5325, LEGISLATIVE BRANCH APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 91

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House began consideration of H.R. 5325, making appropriations for the Legislative Branch for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2017. Consideration is expected to resume tomorrow, June 10th.<P/>Ellison amendment (No. 2 printed in H. Rept. 114-611) that seeks to reprogram funds to create an Office of Good Jobs for the House of Representatives; and<P/>Blackburn amendment (No. 6 printed in H. Rept. 114-611) that seeks to provide for a one percent across the board cut to the bill's spending levels; accounts for the Capitol Police, Architect of the Capitol-Capitol Police Buildings, Grounds and Security, and Office of the Sergeant At Arms shall not be reduced.<P/>H. Res. 771, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5325) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 237 ayes to 182 noes, Roll No. 286, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 241 yeas to 181 nays, Roll No. 285.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House began consideration of H.R. 5325, making appropriations for the Legislative Branch for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2017. Consideration is expected to resume tomorrow, June 10th.<P/>Ellison amendment (No. 2 printed in H. Rept. 114-611) that seeks to reprogram funds to create an Office of Good Jobs for the House of Representatives; and<P/>Blackburn amendment (No. 6 printed in H. Rept. 114-611) that seeks to provide for a one percent across the board cut to the bill's spending levels; accounts for the Capitol Police, Architect of the Capitol-Capitol Police Buildings, Grounds and Security, and Office of the Sergeant At Arms shall not be reduced.<P/>H. Res. 771, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5325) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 237 ayes to 182 noes, Roll No. 286, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 241 yeas to 181 nays, Roll No. 285.

congVote.result: Three-fifths of the Senators duly chosen and sworn not having voted in the affirmative, the motion is rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: : Senate continued consideration of S. 2943, to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2017 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, taking action on the following amendments proposed thereto:<P/>McCain Amendment No. 4607, to amend the provision on share-in-savings contracts.<P/>Reed (for Reid) Amendment No. 4603 (to Amendment No. 4607), to change the enactment date.<P/>During consideration of this measure today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 43 yeas to 55 nays (Vote No. 95), three-fifths of those Senators duly chosen and sworn, not having voted in the affirmative, Senate rejected the motion to close further debate on Reed/Mikulski Amendment No. 4549 (to Amendment No. 4229) (listed below).

congVote.result: Three-fifths of the Senators duly chosen and sworn not having voted in the affirmative, the motion is rejected.
